messages.subject: question for N-H-E-N
messages.msgSnippet: ********** NEW HOMESCHOOLERS NEED YOU! New homeschoolers like to hear from those of us with experience and words of advice.  The upcoming issue of the New
messages.messageBody:
**********
NEW HOMESCHOOLERS NEED YOU!
New homeschoolers like to hear from those of us with experience and
words
of advice. The upcoming issue of the New Homeschool Encouragement
Newsletter (N-H-E-N) focuses on the recurring question, "How do you
handle
the 'hard' subjects, like Algebra, Writing Papers and Advanced
Sciences?"
Please take a moment and send your best advice. It doesn't have to be
long,
just 3-4 lines will be great!
Here's the link for where people can read more about past issues of
N-H-E-N: <http://www.nhen.org/newhser/default.asp?id=418>
*********


Okay - this is an unschooling list so I have to admit here that I'm
sometimes at a loss as to how to respond to questions like this. The
answer is so "off" from what they think they're asking, that I'm
stymied.

But - it IS a question that gets asked, and we'd like to have some
unschooling answers included, so if anybody has anything they'd like to
say, please do so - send it to me or send it to the list, either way I
will make sure it gets to the N-H-E-N editor. Thanks!

-pam
National Home Education Network
<www.NHEN.org>
Serving the entire homeschooling community since 1999
through information, networking and public relations.
